message_1: Calculate the remaining mass of a sample of radium-226 that had an initial mass of 25 grams after 800 years, given that the half-life of radium-226 is 1600 years.
message_2:
To calculate the remaining mass of the radium-226 sample, we can use the formula:

remaining mass = initial mass * (1/2)^(time elapsed / half-life)

where
initial mass = 25 grams
time elapsed = 800 years
half-life = 1600 years

remaining mass = 25 * (1/2)^(800 / 1600)
remaining mass = 25 * (1/2)^0.5

Now, we can calculate (1/2)^0.5:
(1/2)^0.5 ≈ 0.7071

So, the remaining mass is:
remaining mass = 25 * 0.7071 ≈ 17.68 grams

After 800 years, the remaining mass of the radium-226 sample is approximately 17.68 grams.
